page.title: 18HISTORIC PLACES IN SLEAFORD
page.content:
ONE HISTORIC THING IN SLEAFORD IS ITS QUITE FAMOUS CASTLE.ONLY A FEW MOUNDS NOW REMAIN.THE CASTLE WAS BUILT BY ALEXANDER DE CLOIS.BISHOP OF LINCOLN FROM 1123-1147 KING JOHN SPENT A NIGHT IN THE CASTLE AFTER HIS DISASTEROUS CROSSING OF THE WASH.KING HENRY VIII IS ALSO BELIVED TO HAVE STAYED AT SLEAFORD TWICE,HE HELD A STATE COUNCIL AT THE CASTLE. AROUND THE FEW MOUNDS OF THE CASTLE ARE A HILLS WHERE THE MOAT WAS BELIVED TO HAVE BEEN. BASS MALTINGS IS ALSO A HISTORIC PLACE.THEY USED TO MAKE BEER.BARLEY WAS BROUGHT IN OFF THE RAILWAY AND MADE INTO BEER,NOW IT IS USED FOR MR GEORGE PADLEYS USE.
{BY HELEN DOUGHTY (AGE 14)}
